item.title: Trailer teases Emma Watson as Belle
item.description: "Beauty and the Beast" teaser trailer gives a quick glimpse of Emma Watson as Belle in next year's live-action film.
item.ExtractedText: 'Beauty and the Beast' trailer teases Emma Watson as Belle by Frank Pallotta @frankpallotta May 23, 2016: 11:35 AM ET Watch the new 'Beauty and the Beast' trailer with Emma Watson A tale as old as time is getting a retelling. Disney ( DIS ) released the first look at its live action "Beauty and the Beast" on Monday morning. The brief minute and a half long teaser showed off the new look of the film's Gothic castle as well the first glimpse of Emma Watson as Disney princess, Belle. The former "Harry Potter" actress appears in the final moments of the trailer as she reaches out to the Beast's forbidden red rose. The trailer for the film, which is a reimagined version of the 1991 animated classic, does a great job of bringing in subtle references from the original. This includes the score and what sounds like characters like Lumière and Cogsworth. The first "Beauty and the Beast" trailer gives a quick glimpse of Emma Watson as Belle in next year's live-action film. "Look a girl," says Lumière, who is voiced by Ewan McGregor. "What if she is the one?" The trailer ends with the film's release date and the words, "Be Our Guest," a reference to the film's famed song. "Beauty and the Beast" is one of Disney's most treasured films. It was the first full-length animated film to be nominated for Best Picture at the Academy Awards and brought in more than $420 million worldwide in 1991 .
